By far best Spanish teacher I have had, I feel I have learned way more Spanish than I ever did in my three years of high school. If you show up and put in a little effort you will do fine. Wish I could take her for Spanish 2!!!
I have had a good experience with this professor at Clark State.
Very nice, and very willing to help the students.  She makes sure that you understand everything, and is genuinely a great person.  I would HIGHLY recommend taking her course.

Very nice, and extremely helpful.  Makes sure all the students understand the readings, and is willing to work with you if you need anything.  Wonderful professor, and I would HIGHLY recommend taking her course.
Very good professor. She was incredibly nice and very good at teaching. She knows her stuff too and is easy to understand.

She is easy. This was my first and only span class at osu and I hadn't taken spanish since high school. Tests are dept issued, but there are outlines on the dept website. She is easy going and very understanding. No quizzes and easy homework!!
No Comments

You will definitely feel challenged but in a way that keeps you thinking outside of class about the discussions and readings. As long as you can relate the readings/lectures to your own life and show that, then it is an easy A.
Loved her! She is so awesome
Professor Costello cares students a lot and understands students with a great flexibility on homework and participation. As long as you do your best, she won't disappoint you.

I have know Elena for some time now and she is an amazing educator. Everyhthing she says, she says with passion. She isn't afraid to speak her mind which is something that I appreciate in a person and educator. Overall an amazing human being!
Super sweet and caring for all of her students. She's quick to help you because she wants to see you succeed! Take this class with her if you can!

Really caring. She wants every one to succeed in the class. She is always willing to help and is not looking to give you more work than necessary. Loved the class and the best Spanish teacher I've had so far.

Costello is a really great professor! She cares about the success of her students and does her best to teach through participation. The class was fun and laid back, better than any other Spanish classes Ive taken! Do your work and youll do great! She even wrote me a recommendation for a study abroad trip I applied for later in the year!

Andy is an amazing Spanish professor who brings his energy and enthusiasm into the classroom with him. He made logging into a 2 and half hour class each day bearable (and some parts even fun). He is strict with his grading, but he does everything he can to prepare his students well before he grades. Be prepared to work, but Andy will always help.

He is a wonderful person and teacher, but this is just beginning Spanish and it shouldnt have been this hard. Ive taken many Spanish classes in high school and I know a lot, but he expects you to know way too much even in the very first unit. Im disappointed, because I love Spanish, but he made me not like it as much.

You will have to put a lot of effort into this class to get a decent grade. He is very outgoing and has a very loud personality. In-class work and homework is pretty manageable but the tests are all written and challenging especially if you have never taken spanish before. He learned spanish in Spain so he speaks with different pronunciation.

He is the best Professor I had for my Spanish class. He really cares for his students. Although his tests are hard, he explains everything in the class. Complete the online homework and you will do good in the exams.
He facilitates very helpful discussion and is tough but reasonable on grading. I learned so much and it laid a great foundation for my Spanish minor.

He's absolutely wonderful. Take anything he teaches. He doesn't curve and doesn't offer extra credit, but you won't need it if you pay attention in class and do all of your required reading. He has endless enthusiasm and energy, and it really shows in class. The lectures are interactive and well worth your time. I can't recommend him highly enough!

Andy was probably my favorite Spanish instructor I have had so far during my 4 yr Spanish career at OSU. Class was very interesting and I learned a lot not only about Spanish films, but also about Spain's history which I think it's much more important. I would recommend him to anyone taking Spanish classes.
Andy has a great sense of humor! While he didn't assign that many graded assignments, he gave extensive feedback on what he did assign and was very helpful for coming up with ideas for papers.
He insists that he's one of the hardest teachers you'll ever have, but you should ignore this. He epitomizes fairness and he's always willing to help you out.

Andy is really awesome. If you plan on continuing your education in Spanish, he will help you edit papers for future classes. Right now he's a grad student, but he will make a great professor one day.
I hate Spanish, but this guy is a fair and good guy.  The tests are written by the department and not by him but he is a fairly easy grader.  He is a good guy
